Package com.example.qreate.attendee

Class CurrentEventsFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.qreate.attendee.CurrentEventsFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner, EventArrayAdapter.OnEventSelectedListener
public class CurrentEventsFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment implements EventArrayAdapter.OnEventSelectedListener
The CurrentEventsFragment is responsible for displaying a list of events that the user is currently signed up for. It utilizes an EventArrayAdapter to display each event in a ListView. The fragment provides functionality to navigate to the event details, update the user's profile, and log out through a popup menu.

    • loadAllEvents

      public void loadAllEvents()
      Fetches all events that the user is signed up for from Firestore and updates the ListView with these events. This method filters the events to only include those that are occurring today.

    • onEventSelected

      public void onEventSelected()
      Handles the event selection action by hiding the bottom navigation bar and showing the details navigation bar.
      Specified by:
      onEventSelected in interface EventArrayAdapter.OnEventSelectedListener

    • getSelectedEventId

      public String getSelectedEventId()
      Retrieves the ID of the currently selected event. This ID can be used for further operations, such as fetching event details.
      Returns:
      The ID of the selected event, or null if no event is selected.

    • removeEventFromList

      public void removeEventFromList(String eventId)
      Removes an event from the event list based on its ID. This method is typically called when an event needs to be removed from the user's current events list, such as after a user unregisters from the event.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The document ID of the event to be removed from the list.
